title: James Chapter 4 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on James chapter 4 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: James Chapter 4 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of James Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to James 4:1, from where do wars and fightings among people come?
options: From your lusts that war in your members
questions.correctAnswer: From your lusts that war in your members
questions.explanation: James 4:1 states that wars and fightings come from your lusts that war in your members.

questions.question: What reason does James 4:2 give for why people fight and war but do not have?
questions.correctAnswer: Because they ask not
questions.explanation: James 4:2 explains that people fight and war but do not have because they ask not.

questions.question: Why do people not receive when they ask, according to James 4:3?
options: Because they ask amiss to consume it upon their lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Because they ask amiss to consume it upon their lusts
questions.explanation: James 4:3 says that people ask and receive not because they ask amiss, intending to consume it upon their lusts.

questions.question: James 4:4 refers to those who are friends of the world as what?
questions.correctAnswer: Enemies of God
questions.explanation: James 4:4 states that whoever will be a friend of the world is the enemy of God.

questions.question: According to James 4:6, God resists whom?
questions.correctAnswer: The proud
questions.explanation: James 4:6 says God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble.

questions.question: What should believers do to God and the devil, according to James 4:7?
options: Submit to God and resist the devil
Ignore both God and the devil
Submit to the devil and resist God
questions.correctAnswer: Submit to God and resist the devil
questions.explanation: James 4:7 instructs to submit yourselves to God and resist the devil, and he will flee from you.

questions.question: What will happen if you draw nigh to God, according to James 4:8?
options: He will draw nigh to you
questions.correctAnswer: He will draw nigh to you
questions.explanation: James 4:8 promises that if you draw nigh to God, He will draw nigh to you.

questions.question: What does James 4:10 say will happen if you humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: He shall lift you up
questions.explanation: James 4:10 says that humbling yourselves before the Lord will result in Him lifting you up.

questions.question: According to James 4:11, what should brethren not do to one another?
questions.correctAnswer: Speak evil
questions.explanation: James 4:11 commands not to speak evil of one another.

questions.question: Who is described as the only lawgiver in James 4:12?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: James 4:12 states there is one lawgiver who is able to save and destroy, referring to God.

questions.question: True or False: James 4:14 compares life to a vapour that appears for a little time and then vanishes away.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 4:14 compares life to a vapour that appears briefly and then vanishes.

questions.question: True or False: According to James 4:15, believers should say 'If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this or that.'
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 4:15 teaches believers to say 'If the Lord will, we shall live, and do this or that.'

questions.question: True or False: James 4:16 states that rejoicing in boastings is good.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: James 4:16 says all rejoicing in boastings is evil.

questions.question: Complete the verse from James 4:9: 'Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep: let your laughter be turned to _______, and your joy to heaviness.'
questions.correctAnswer: mourning
questions.explanation: James 4:9 says laughter should be turned to mourning and joy to heaviness.

questions.question: According to James 4:17, what is sin?
options: To know good and not do it
To do good and not know it
questions.correctAnswer: To know good and not do it
questions.explanation: James 4:17 states that to him who knows to do good and does it not, to him it is sin.

medium.title: James Chapter 4 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from James Chapter 4 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with jealousy and conflict in their church community. Based on James 4:1-3, what biblical truth would you share about the root cause of these conflicts?
options: They arise from the lusts that battle within us
They are caused by misunderstandings only
They result from a lack of church discipline
questions.correctAnswer: They arise from the lusts that battle within us
questions.explanation: James 4:1 explains that wars and fightings come from the lusts that war within us, and verses 2-3 show that these conflicts arise from unmet desires and asking amiss.

questions.question: How does James 4:4 warn believers about their relationship with the world?
options: Friendship with the world makes one an enemy of God
The world is a neutral place for believers
questions.correctAnswer: Friendship with the world makes one an enemy of God
questions.explanation: James 4:4 clearly states that friendship with the world is enmity with God, and those who choose to be friends with the world are enemies of God.

questions.question: According to James 4:6, what attitude does God resist and what attitude does He give grace to?
options: God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble
God resists the humble but gives grace to the proud
God resists the strong but gives grace to the weak
God resists the meek but gives grace to the bold
questions.correctAnswer: God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble
questions.explanation: Verse 6 teaches that God opposes the proud but gives grace to those who are humble, emphasizing the importance of humility in the Christian walk.

questions.question: A believer is facing temptation from the devil. According to James 4:7, what is the proper response?
options: Submit to God and resist the devil so he will flee
Ignore the temptation and hope it passes
Try to reason with the devil
Avoid all situations where temptation could arise
questions.correctAnswer: Submit to God and resist the devil so he will flee
questions.explanation: James 4:7 instructs believers to submit to God and resist the devil, promising that the devil will flee when resisted in submission to God.

questions.question: According to James 4:8, what is the promised outcome when believers draw near to God?
options: God will draw near to them
They will be free from all troubles
They will become popular in the church
questions.correctAnswer: God will draw near to them
questions.explanation: James 4:8 promises that if believers draw near to God, He will in turn draw near to them, highlighting the reciprocal nature of a close relationship with God.

questions.question: What practical step does James 4:10 teach about humility before God?
options: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up
Boast about your achievements to God
Ignore your faults and focus on others
Only humble when others are watching
questions.correctAnswer: Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and He will lift you up
questions.explanation: James 4:10 encourages believers to humble themselves before God, with the promise that God will exalt those who humble themselves.

questions.question: How does James 4:11-12 instruct believers regarding judging others?
options: Do not speak evil or judge others because God alone is Lawgiver and Judge
Judge others to keep them in line
Ignore sin in others to avoid judgment
questions.correctAnswer: Do not speak evil or judge others because God alone is Lawgiver and Judge
questions.explanation: These verses clarify that believers should not speak evil or judge others, as there is only one Lawgiver and Judge, God, who alone has authority over salvation and destruction.

questions.question: A believer plans business activities without consulting God. What does James 4:13-15 teach about such plans?
options: They should say 'If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that'
They should confidently plan without hesitation
They should depend only on their own wisdom
questions.correctAnswer: They should say 'If the Lord wills, we shall live and do this or that'
questions.explanation: James 4:13-15 teaches believers to acknowledge God's sovereignty in their plans by saying 'If the Lord will,' recognizing life's uncertainty and God's ultimate control.

questions.question: Based on James 4:14, how should believers view the brevity of life in making daily decisions?
options: As a vapor that appears briefly and then vanishes
As a long journey with no end
As a guarantee of future success
As a time to accumulate wealth without concern
questions.correctAnswer: As a vapor that appears briefly and then vanishes
questions.explanation: Verse 14 compares life to a vapor, emphasizing its fleeting nature and urging believers to live with humility and dependence on God.

questions.question: According to James 4:16, how does the chapter view boasting about future plans without God’s will?
options: It is encouraged as confident faith
questions.correctAnswer: Such rejoicing is evil
questions.explanation: James 4:16 states that boasting without acknowledging God's will is evil, warning believers against prideful presumptions.

questions.question: What does James 4:17 say about knowing to do good but failing to do it?
options: It is sin to not do good when you know to do it
It is acceptable to delay doing good
It is excused if one is busy
questions.correctAnswer: It is sin to not do good when you know to do it
questions.explanation: Verse 17 teaches that neglecting to do good when one knows what to do is sin, highlighting the responsibility of obedience.

questions.question: True or False: James 4:9 encourages believers to turn their laughter into mourning as a sign of repentance.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 4:9 calls believers to be afflicted, mourn, and let laughter be turned into mourning as a sign of genuine repentance and humility before God.

questions.question: True or False: According to James 4:5, the Spirit in us desires to envy, which causes internal conflict.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 4:5 mentions that the spirit dwelling in us lusts to envy, indicating the internal struggles believers face with envy and desire.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: James 4:8 instructs believers to cleanse their ______ and purify their ______.
questions.correctAnswer: hands, hearts
questions.explanation: Verse 8 specifically calls for cleansing hands and purifying hearts, emphasizing both external actions and internal motives.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to speak evil about a fellow Christian. Based on James 4:11, what should they remember?
options: Speaking evil judges the law, and judging the law makes one a judge
Speaking evil is acceptable to protect the church
It is better to remain silent than to speak evil
Speaking evil shows zeal for righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: Speaking evil judges the law, and judging the law makes one a judge
questions.explanation: James 4:11 explains that speaking evil of others judges the law itself, and judging the law makes one a judge rather than a doer, warning against slander.

hard.title: James Chapter 4 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from James Chapter 4.

questions.question: According to James 4:1, what is the root cause of wars and fightings among believers?
options: Their lusts that war within them
questions.correctAnswer: Their lusts that war within them
questions.explanation: James 4:1 explicitly states that wars and fightings come from the lusts that war within members, indicating internal desires as the root cause.

questions.question: In James 4:3, why do believers sometimes not receive what they ask for?
options: Because they ask amiss to consume it on their lusts
Because they do not pray enough
questions.correctAnswer: Because they ask amiss to consume it on their lusts
questions.explanation: James 4:3 explains that requests are not granted because they are asked with wrong motives, specifically to satisfy selfish desires.

questions.question: James 4:4 uses the term 'adulterers and adulteresses' metaphorically to describe those who:
questions.correctAnswer: Love the world over God
questions.explanation: The metaphor in James 4:4 refers to those who are unfaithful to God by aligning themselves as friends with the world, which is enmity against God.

questions.question: Which Greek word translated as 'lusteth' in James 4:5 conveys strong desire or envy?
questions.correctAnswer: Epipotheo
questions.explanation: The Greek term 'epipotheo' used in James 4:5 describes an intense desire or longing, here rendered as lusting to envy.

questions.question: James 4:6 contrasts God’s grace with what human attitude?
questions.correctAnswer: Pride
questions.explanation: Verse 6 states that God resists the proud but gives grace to the humble, highlighting pride as the opposing human attitude to grace.

questions.question: What is the sequence of actions James commands believers to take in James 4:7?
options: Submit to God, resist the devil, and he will flee
Confess sins, forgive others, and repent
Study the law, teach it, and obey it
questions.correctAnswer: Submit to God, resist the devil, and he will flee
questions.explanation: James 4:7 directs believers to submit themselves to God and resist the devil, promising that resistance will cause the devil to flee.

questions.question: In James 4:8, what parallelism is used to describe the relationship between God and the believer?
options: Draw nigh to God and He will draw nigh to you
Cleanse your hands and purify your hearts
questions.correctAnswer: Draw nigh to God and He will draw nigh to you
questions.explanation: James 4:8 uses parallelism to show mutual nearness between God and the believer—drawing near to God results in God drawing near as well.

questions.question: The call to 'Be afflicted, and mourn, and weep' in James 4:9 is an example of which literary device?
questions.correctAnswer: Synonymous parallelism
questions.explanation: James 4:9 repeats similar commands in synonymous parallelism to emphasize repentance and sorrow for sin.

questions.question: According to James 4:11, what is the danger in judging another brother?
options: You become a judge of the law instead of a doer
You will be judged more harshly
You break fellowship with the church
You contradict the teachings of Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: You become a judge of the law instead of a doer
questions.explanation: James 4:11 warns that judging others places one in the role of lawgiver or judge rather than obeying the law oneself.

questions.question: What theological truth is emphasized in James 4:12 about judgment?
options: Only God is the Lawgiver and Judge
Judgment belongs to the elders of the church
Judgment is based on Mosaic Law
questions.correctAnswer: Only God is the Lawgiver and Judge
questions.explanation: James 4:12 affirms monotheism and God’s exclusive authority to save and destroy, emphasizing human limitations in judgment.

questions.question: James 4:13-14 critiques the attitude of those who confidently plan their future without acknowledging what?
options: The uncertainty of life and God’s will
questions.correctAnswer: The uncertainty of life and God’s will
questions.explanation: These verses challenge presumptuous planning that ignores life’s brevity and dependence on God's sovereign will.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from James 4:15: 'For that ye ought to say, If the Lord ____, we shall live, and do this, or that.'
questions.correctAnswer: will
questions.explanation: The verse emphasizes humility and dependence on God's will by instructing believers to say 'If the Lord will.'

questions.question: According to James 4:16, how should believers view boasting about future plans?
questions.correctAnswer: As evil
questions.explanation: James 4:16 condemns rejoicing in boasting as evil, teaching humility before God.

questions.question: True or False: James 4:10 promises that God will exalt those who humble themselves before Him.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: James 4:10 explicitly states that those who humble themselves will be lifted up by the Lord, confirming this promise.

questions.question: What is the sin described in James 4:17?
options: Knowing to do good and not doing it
questions.correctAnswer: Knowing to do good and not doing it
questions.explanation: James 4:17 defines sin as the failure to act on known good, emphasizing moral responsibility.

theological.title: James Chapter 4 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from James Chapter 4 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to James 4:1, what is the primary source of wars and fightings among believers?
options: Their lusts that war within them
questions.correctAnswer: Their lusts that war within them
questions.explanation: James 4:1 states that wars and fightings come from the lusts that war within our members. This aligns with Galatians 5:17 which speaks of the conflict between flesh and Spirit; also Romans 7:23 and 1 John 2:16 discuss internal sinful desires as the root of conflict.

questions.question: What reason does James give in 4:3 for why prayers are not answered?
options: Because they ask amiss to consume on their lusts
questions.correctAnswer: Because they ask amiss to consume on their lusts
questions.explanation: James 4:3 explains unanswered prayers result from asking with wrong motives, specifically to fulfill selfish desires. This is consistent with 1 John 5:14-15 on praying according to God's will, and Proverbs 21:27 about prayers of the wicked being an abomination.

questions.question: In James 4:4, what does friendship with the world equate to?
questions.correctAnswer: Being an enemy of God
questions.explanation: James 4:4 declares friendship with the world is enmity with God, making one His enemy. This teaching aligns with 1 John 2:15-16 which warns against loving the world, and Romans 12:2 about not conforming to the world.

questions.question: What does James say God gives to the humble in James 4:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Grace
questions.explanation: James 4:6 states God gives more grace to the humble, contrasting with resisting the proud. This matches 1 Peter 5:5-6 on humility receiving God’s grace and Proverbs 3:34 about God opposing the proud.

questions.question: What two actions does James 4:7 urge believers to do in response to spiritual conflict?
options: Submit to God and resist the devil
questions.correctAnswer: Submit to God and resist the devil
questions.explanation: James 4:7 commands submission to God and resistance against the devil, promising the devil will flee. This parallels Ephesians 6:11-12 on spiritual warfare and 1 Peter 5:8-9 exhorting resistance.

questions.question: According to James 4:8, what is the promised result of drawing nigh to God?
options: He will draw nigh to you
You will be free from trials
questions.correctAnswer: He will draw nigh to you
questions.explanation: James 4:8 promises that if we draw near to God, He will draw near to us. This reflects Psalm 145:18 about God being near to all who call on Him and Hebrews 10:22 urging believers to approach God with a pure heart.

questions.question: What emotional response does James 4:9 encourage believers to exhibit?
questions.correctAnswer: Affliction, mourning, and weeping
questions.explanation: James 4:9 calls for mourning and weeping as a sign of repentance and humility before God. This corresponds with Joel 2:12-13 and Psalm 51:17 which emphasize broken and contrite hearts as pleasing to God.

questions.question: What does James 4:10 promise to those who humble themselves before the Lord?
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be lifted up
questions.explanation: James 4:10 assures that God will exalt those who humble themselves, parallel to 1 Peter 5:6 and Proverbs 3:34 which affirm God's favor on the humble.

questions.question: According to James 4:11, what is wrong about speaking evil of a brother?
options: It judges the law and makes one a judge instead of a doer
It is a sign of ignorance
It is a form of idolatry
questions.correctAnswer: It judges the law and makes one a judge instead of a doer
questions.explanation: James 4:11 teaches that speaking evil of a brother judges the law, which is improper since one should be a doer, not a judge. This relates to Matthew 7:1-5 about judging others and Romans 14:4 on God being the only rightful judge.

questions.question: Who does James 4:12 identify as the only Lawgiver and Judge?
questions.correctAnswer: God
questions.explanation: James 4:12 identifies God as the sole Lawgiver and Judge who can save and destroy. This matches Deuteronomy 32:39 and Romans 14:10-12 where God alone judges humanity.

questions.question: What attitude towards future plans does James 4:13-15 caution against?
options: Boasting arrogantly without acknowledging God's will
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting arrogantly without acknowledging God's will
questions.explanation: James 4:13-15 warns against arrogantly boasting about future plans without saying 'If the Lord wills.' This echoes Proverbs 27:1 and Matthew 6:34 about trusting God's sovereignty over the future.

questions.question: How does James 4:14 describe human life?
options: As a vapor that appears briefly and then vanishes
questions.correctAnswer: As a vapor that appears briefly and then vanishes
questions.explanation: James 4:14 compares life to a vapor that appears briefly and vanishes, emphasizing human frailty. This agrees with Psalm 39:5-6 and Job 7:7-10 illustrating the brevity of life.

questions.question: What does James 4:16 say about rejoicing in boastings?
questions.correctAnswer: All such rejoicing is evil
questions.explanation: James 4:16 declares rejoicing in boastings is evil, condemning prideful self-exaltation. This aligns with Proverbs 16:18 on pride coming before destruction and Luke 18:14 praising humility.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in James 4:17 for those who know to do good but do not do it?
questions.correctAnswer: It is sin for them
questions.explanation: James 4:17 states that to know good and not do it is sin, emphasizing responsibility before God. This is consistent with Ezekiel 18:21-24 and Luke 12:47-48 about accountability for actions and omissions.

questions.question: What internal struggle does James 4:5 highlight about the spirit dwelling in us?
questions.correctAnswer: It lusteth to envy
questions.explanation: James 4:5 notes the spirit within us lusts to envy, showing the sinful nature's tendency toward covetousness. This agrees with Romans 7:15-25 and Galatians 5:19-21 describing internal desires opposing God’s law.
